articles.headline: A Superyacht Gave a Lifeline to 100 Migrants Thrown Into the Sea
articles.snippet: A $175 million vessel responded to a distress call and helped rescue survivors in one of the Mediterranean’s worst wrecks in decades, reflecting the new inequality of the seas.
articles.abstract: A $175 million vessel responded to a distress call and helped rescue survivors in one of the Mediterranean’s worst wrecks in decades, reflecting the new inequality of the seas.
articles.lead_paragraph: The superyacht Mayan Queen IV was sailing smoothly in clear weather through the dark and calm Mediterranean in the early hours of June 14 when it received a call about a migrant ship in distress four nautical miles away.
articles.byline: By Jason Horowitz and Matina Stevis-Gridneff

articles.headline: Daniel Ellsberg, Pentagon Papers Source, Had Uneasy Relationship With The Times
articles.snippet: Mr. Ellsberg took issue with how the newspaper portrayed his role, and how he was treated by the project’s primary reporter.
articles.abstract: Mr. Ellsberg took issue with how the newspaper portrayed his role, and how he was treated by the project’s primary reporter.
articles.lead_paragraph: The relationship between The New York Times and its most famous source, Daniel Ellsberg, reads like a thriller, replete with clandestine meetings, top secret documents and a war raging in the background.

articles.headline: China’s Cloud Computing Firms Raise Concern for U.S.
articles.snippet: The Biden administration is exploring whether it can mount a campaign against Chinese tech giants like Alibaba and Huawei, potentially fueling tensions with Beijing.
articles.abstract: The Biden administration is exploring whether it can mount a campaign against Chinese tech giants like Alibaba and Huawei, potentially fueling tensions with Beijing.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the digital cold war between the United States and China, American officials are increasingly turning their attention to a new target: Chinese cloud computing giants.

articles.headline: Biden Seeks to Bolster Ties With Modi While Soft-Pedaling Differences
articles.snippet: At the White House, the president emphasized common ground with India’s prime minister and announced joint initiatives without making progress in enlisting help against Russian aggression.
articles.abstract: At the White House, the president emphasized common ground with India’s prime minister and announced joint initiatives without making progress in enlisting help against Russian aggression.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden emphasized common ground with Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India during a lavish state visit on Thursday, publicly skirting points of friction over the government’s crackdown on human rights in India and Russia’s war in Ukraine in hopes of bolstering economic and geopolitical ties with the world’s most populous nation.

articles.headline: Ford’s Battery Joint Venture to Get $9.2 Billion Government Loan
articles.snippet: The money will help finance three plants the automaker and its partner, SK On, are building in Kentucky and Tennessee.
articles.abstract: The money will help finance three plants the automaker and its partner, SK On, are building in Kentucky and Tennessee.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ford Motor and its battery manufacturing partner will receive a $9.2 billion loan to build three battery factories in Kentucky and Tennessee, the Department of Energy said Thursday. The loan is the single biggest financial commitment the Biden administration has made in its effort to build an electric vehicle manufacturing network in the United States.
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing and Clifford Krauss

articles.headline: Spiraling Violence in the Occupied West Bank Signals a Loss of Control
articles.snippet: The Palestinian Authority is absent from the hotbeds of militancy while Israeli forces have failed to prevent violent reprisal attacks by Jewish extremists.
articles.abstract: The Palestinian Authority is absent from the hotbeds of militancy while Israeli forces have failed to prevent violent reprisal attacks by Jewish extremists.
articles.lead_paragraph: The northern West Bank was once viewed by Israeli, Palestinian and international authorities as a kind of pilot program for Israeli disengagement from the occupied territory, and by some even as a potential prototype for a future Palestinian state.

articles.headline: A North Korean Dissident Defects to the American Right
articles.snippet: Yeonmi Park’s account of the horrors of North Korea made her a human rights celebrity. Her new claims that America is on the same path have made her a right-wing media star.
articles.abstract: Yeonmi Park’s account of the horrors of North Korea made her a human rights celebrity. Her new claims that America is on the same path have made her a right-wing media star.
articles.lead_paragraph: “The first thing my mom taught me as a young girl living in North Korea was don’t even whisper, because birds and mice could hear me,” Yeonmi Park told the audience that had come to hear her speak in Queens.
